abstract.p: Spain's Banco Santander Central Hispano abandons talks with Commerzbank of Germany on raising its stake in Commerzbank from 5.1 percent to 10 percent (S)

block.p: The Spanish banking company Banco Santander Central Hispano announced that it had abandoned talks with Commerzbank of Germany on raising its stake in Commerzbank from 5.1 percent, to 10 percent. A spokesman for Commerzbank told Spanish reporters that the negotiations had foundered over differences on fixing the value of CC-Bank, which is owned by Banco Santander and specializes in automobile financing in Germany. Banco Santander would have traded CC-Bank and cash for the additional 4.9 percent stake in Commerzbank. Analysts said Commerzbank had hoped a larger stake for Banco Santander would help fend off a hostile bid from Cobra, a German investment group, which is the bank's major shareholder with 17 percent.

The Spanish banking company Banco Santander Central Hispano announced that it had abandoned talks with Commerzbank of Germany on raising its stake in Commerzbank from 5.1 percent, to 10 percent. A spokesman for Commerzbank told Spanish reporters that the negotiations had foundered over differences on fixing the value of CC-Bank, which is owned by Banco Santander and specializes in automobile financing in Germany. Banco Santander would have traded CC-Bank and cash for the additional 4.9 percent stake in Commerzbank. Analysts said Commerzbank had hoped a larger stake for Banco Santander would help fend off a hostile bid from Cobra, a German investment group, which is the bank's major shareholder with 17 percent.
